questions.text: Finish this statement made by Josh: "This is ______-time in Santos-McGarry land."
questions.explanation:
Christmas.

	Josh was reading off the first gallup polling numbers for the Santos-McGarry campaign to Matt Santos as they were leaving Bayburn.

questions.text: In a newspaper, what cartoon was played out with Leo, Matt, and President Bartlet?
questions.explanation:
The Wizard Of Oz.

	President Bartlet was the man behind the curtain while Leo was the big head and Matt was dressed in a Dorothy costume cowering in front of the big head.

questions.text: Josh hired Donna as his deputy.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Donna went to Josh for a job as his new deputy, but Josh wouldn't hire her because of the derogatory things she said about Santos.

questions.text: When the episode started three years into the future, what was everyone attending?
questions.explanation:
Dedication of President Bartlet's library.

	In the year 2008, CJ and Danny had a baby, Will was a Congressman, Kate wrote a book.

questions.text: Josh told Matt and Helen Santos that he would take most of the credit for the things that which person did for the Santos-McGarry campaign?
options: Edie Ortega, Deputy Campaign Manager for Strategic Planning
questions.explanation:
Julian Mirada, Deputy Policy Director.

	Josh introduced Matt and Helen Santos to the staff that would be working to elect Matt as President. Edie Ortega was the first person that Josh introduced. Josh referred to John Vega as being part of the minority row because he was at a desk beside the coordinator from African American affairs, Veteran Affairs, and Women for Santos.

questions.text: What magazine was Josh looking at with a picture of Matt Santos on it?
questions.explanation:
Time.

	After Josh and Matt were in the SUV, Matt said that Helen wanted to turn the picture in the magazine into T-shirts. Josh said that was fine as long as she took out the question mark.

questions.text: At the strategy meeting, what word did Joey Lucas use to describe Matt Santos?
questions.explanation:
Hunky.

	After hearing Joey call him hunky, Matt said he would have gone with telegenic.

questions.text: Who left a job at the White House to head Leo's campaign?
questions.explanation:
Annabeth.

	Annabeth was first seen with Leo when they got out of the SUV at the Port of Philadelphia. She corrected his pronunciation of Matt Santos' last name.

questions.text: Who did Oliver suggest was CJ's "new Danny"?
questions.explanation:
Greg Brock.

	In "Full Disclosure", Greg Brock was the journalist who gave CJ a copy of the book that Hoynes wrote. Oliver Babish suggested that CJ is seeing Brock and that she slipped him the information about the top secret space shuttle from "2162 Votes".

No.

	At the end of the episode, Leo gave Matt the chance to fire him, but Matt wouldn't because he liked Leo and knew Leo would be good. He made it clear to Leo that when phone calls needed to be made Matt would be making them.
